page.title: 05Farm Life in Smethcott
page.content: The farm houses are large and old but facilities compare favourably with those in towns.Washing machines, fridges,freezers,electric cookers and televisions are commonplace.Mains gas is not available and mains water is only being connected this year.Until now the water supply has been from local wells. As there is no public transport, farmers'wives drive to supermarkets for most shopping.Bread making at home is no longer common,but women bake regularly,make jam,bottle and freeze home grown fruit and vegetables and are responsible for gardening. Craftwork such as knitting and tapestry are popular pastimes.Outside interests include Womens'Institute, Young Farmers' Club,the Grassland Society and the British Horse Driving Society.
